item.title: Rubbish on street, 20th September
item.description:
This rubbish has been here for 1 week and getting bigger as people add to it. Car park behind royal inn pub and 89 wetherell road the Guinness trust have been notified as said that side of the road is Hackney council responsibility

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wetherell Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road sign and salt box have been graffitied, 20th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Newbery Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic calming poles have been removed, 20th September
item.description:
The road laws in place to allow pedestrians to walk safely on the right hand side, from Footscray Road direction, are not being followed as the poles to restrict the traffic to a single lane have been removed. They have been placed in to nearby hedges, so it doesn't seem accidental. They need to be more permanently fixed in place or this will continue to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction to pavement closed to pedestrians, 20th September
item.description:
For over 4 hrs pedestrian walkway is closed with no permit, signage or ramps for disabled people. Westminster needs to act on the constant pavement closure.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Leinster Square, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serious dog poo issues on Fenwick Road, 20th September
item.description:
Someone, or multiple people, are repeatedly letting their dog poo along Fenwick Road. Clearly theyâ€™re walking them at night to try get away with this. The problem is getting so bad that residents are constantly having to dodge large dog poos and put up with the overwhelmingly unpleasant odour. This photo was taken just now outside my house by my car (at no. 41). Can you please come and get rid of these poos and install CCTV cameras as this is a really bad, reoccurring problem up and down the road. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Fenwick Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped items dumped by someone from 19.09.25 likely, 20th September
item.description:
